ch.iserver.ace.algorithm.test
Interface Node

All Known Subinterfaces:
GenerationNode, ReceptionNode
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGenerationNode, AbstractNode, DoNode, EndNode, RedoNode, RelayNode, SimpleReceptionNode, StartNode, UndoNode, VerificationNode
public interface Node

The node interface represents a node in a scenario graph. Nodes represent characteristic events in such a graph. So there are nodes for reception/generation of messages as well as nodes that represent the start and end of a site lifecycle.

Method Summary
 void accept(NodeVisitor visitor)
          Accepts the given node visitor.

          Gets the local successor of this node.

          Gets the id of the participant this node belongs to.

Method Detail

getParticipantId

String getParticipantId()
Gets the id of the participant this node belongs to.

Returns:
the participant id

getSuccessors

List getSuccessors()
Gets a list of successors of this node. This includes local successors (i.e. from the same site) as well as in some cases remote successors.

Note that the return value is never null. If there are no successors, implementors should return an empty list.

Returns:
the list of successors

getLocalSuccessor

Node getLocalSuccessor()
Gets the local successor of this node. There is never more than one local successors.

Returns:
the local successor

setLocalSuccessor

void setLocalSuccessor(Node successor)
Sets the local successor of this node. The old successor is replaced by the new one.

Parameters:
successor - the new local successor

accept

void accept(NodeVisitor visitor)
Accepts the given node visitor. This is used for double dispatching.

Parameters:
visitor - the visitor that wishes to visit this node
